hanzi-su-wiki:
括

Значения

Связывать, собирать (воедино)

Мнемоника

Язык 舌 связан с руками 扌. При разговоре мы жестикулируем.
purpleculture_pinyin:
kuò
to enclose; to include; also pr. [gua1]
вложить; включать; также пр. [gua1]
rtega_mnemonic:
括括RSinclude, embrace, enclose, seek, come, bound
  • tongue 舌 instructing the hand 扌 to bind or embrace someone or something
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 舌 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
包括 [ bāo kuò ]: to comprise; to include; to involve; to incorporate; to consist of
概括 [ gài kuò ]: to summarize; to generalize; briefly; Classifiers: 个
囊括 [ náng kuò ]: to include; to embrace; to bring together
括号 [ kuò hào ]: parentheses; brackets
总括 [ zǒng kuò ]: to sum up; all-inclusive
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 舌 [ shé ] tongue; bell clapper
heisig_chinese_memo: The teacher was always telling us to fasten our lips by pulling a zipper shut with her fingers.  She would tell us to make sure we poke our tongues inside our mouths before zippering shut.  If anyone wasn't zipping she'd say "and that includes you!"
heisig_constituent: fasten, finger, fingers, tongue, thousand, mouth
koohiiStory1: Teacher was always telling us to fasten our lips by pulling a zipper shut with our fingers. It always frightened me because I imagined getting my tongue stuck in the zipper.
koohiiStory2: On the plane, you refuse to FASTEN your seatbelt and even go so far as to give the stewardess the finger and stick out your tongue at her. The crew comes and pins you down and forces you to FASTEN it.
jp_example_words:
一括(いっかつ): all together, batch, one lump, one bundle, summing up
括弧(かっこ): parenthesis, brackets
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Someone's fingers touch your tongue and fasten it together. You can't talk. All you can do is make sad tongue-less sounds as you try to figure out who would fasten your tongue like this.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Try to fasten your own tongue with your fingers right now. You probably can't do it, right? That's because your fingers are too big and your tongue is too slippery.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Only one creature could use its fingers to fasten your tongue like this: cats (かつ). Cats are notorious for fastening tongues so that people can't speak. Haven't you ever heard the phrase, "Cat got your tongue?"
WaniKani_Reading_Info: In this case, many cats fastened your tongue. You should probably be nicer to cats from now on so this doesn't happen again.
Ru_Radicals: ノ, 十 (десять), 口 (рот), 扎, 舌 (язык)
Ru_trainchinese:
kuò: (графема) включать (в себя); связывать, стягивать
kuò: (глаг) брать текст в скобки
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the tongue (舌) by the hand (扌) is fastened in place
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The teacher was always telling us to fasten our lips by pulling a zipper shut with her fingers.  She would tell us to make sure we poke our tongues inside our mouths before zippering shut.  If anyone wasn't zipping she'd say "and that includes you!"
humanum_full_description_en:
Same as " 𢬸 ", from " hand "," 𠯑 "sound, which means ligation and binding. "Shuowen": "Yeah. From the hand, 𠯑 sound." "Zhuangzi‧ Fable": "Xiang Ye Kuo, and now it is also sent." Cheng Xuanying Shu: "Quiet, tie hair also."

" Enclosed " can be extended to refer to constraints. "Kong Congzi‧ Zhijie": "Enclose his monarch with rituals, so that he can enter into goodness."

" Kuo " also means block or occlusion. "Yi·Xi Cixia": "A gentleman hides his implements in his body and moves when he waits for the time. Why is it disadvantageous? To move without enclosing it is to get something out of it, and to move when the language becomes a device." Zhu Xi's original meaning: " It’s not an obstacle.”

" Kuo " also means tolerance and inclusion. Jin Luji's "On Debate on Death": "The land of Baiyue in the east, and the list of barbarians in the south."

" Enclosed " can refer to collecting and collecting. Jin Gehong's "Baopuzi·Jia Dun": "Playing with pictures in the extinct yakuza, including algae and beautiful birds and beasts."

" Enclosed " also means inspection and registration. "Xin Tang Shu-Su Gui Biography": "The Ten Dao envoys of the time included the deceased households in the world. At the beginning, they did not establish a registration. People searched for themselves, and then they flowed into the county, which is more confined.

" Kuo " also refers to the law. "Book of Yi Zhou‧ Five Powers": "If you don't obey you, you won't declare food, you won't be proclaimed to ministers. If you appreciate the most, you won't eat, but you won't eat." In order to seize its responsibilities."
humanum_short_description_en: Same as " 𢬸 ", from " hand " to" 𠯑 ", which means ligation and binding.
humanum_full_description:
同「𢬸」，從「手」，「𠯑」聲，表示結扎、捆束。《說文》：「絜也。从手，𠯑聲。」《莊子‧寓言》：「向也括，而今也被髮。」成玄英疏：「括，撮束髮也。」

　　「括」可引申指約束。《孔叢子‧執節》：「以禮括其君，使入於善也。」

　　「括」還表示阻滯、閉塞。《易‧繫辭下》：「君子藏器于身，待時而動，何不利之有？動而不括，是以出而有獲，語成器而動者也。」朱熹本義：「括，結礙也。」

　　「括」亦表示包容、包括。晉陸機《辯亡論上》：「東包百越之地，南括群蠻之表。」

　　「括」可指搜集、搜括。晉葛洪《抱樸子‧嘉遁》：「玩圖籍於絕跡之藪，括藻麗乎鳥獸之群。」

　　「括」也表示查驗、登記。《新唐書‧蘇瑰傳》：「時十道使括天下亡戶，初不立籍，人自搜括，即流入比縣旁州，更相廋蔽。」

　　「括」也指法則。《逸周書‧五權》：「不遵奉括食不宣，不宣授臣，極賞則淈，淈得不食。」朱右曾校釋：「括，法也。官不奉法，以奪其祿。」
humanum_short_description: 同「𢬸」，從「手」，「𠯑」聲，表示結扎、捆束。

括字的基本解释

括
kuò
扎，束：括发（束起头发）。括约肌。
包容：包括。概括。总括。囊括。

括
guā
　ㄍㄨㄚˉ
榨取，搜求：搜括（亦作“搜刮”）。

括字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kuò］
［《廣韻》古活切，入末，見。］
［《集韻》苦活切，入末，溪。］
亦作“1”。
(1)结扎，捆束。
(2)引申指约束。
(3)阻滞；闭塞。
(4)包容；包括。
(5)用以指科举的应试概要。参阅清赵翼《陔馀丛考·帖括策括》。
(6)搜集；搜括。
(7)查验，登记。
(8)会合；到来。
(9)法。
(10)方言。掴，打。
(11)通“栝”。箭的末端，与弓弦交会处。
(12)谓箭上弦。
(13)通“廥”。仓库。
[②]［guō］
［《廣韻》古活切，入末，見。］
通“聒1”。
[③]［guā］
(1)削；削除。
(2)摩擦。
(3)吹。
(4)见“挺括”。

括字的英文翻译

◎ 括
draw together, include

括字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　括； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页427第19
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?古活切，音聒。【說文】本作?。絜也。【廣韻】結也。【增韻】包括也。【易·坤卦】括囊无咎无譽。又【繫辭】動而不括。【疏】括結而有礙也。【前漢·?項傳贊】包舉宇內，囊括四海。【揚子·方言】括關閉也。　又【廣韻】至也。【詩·王風】日之夕矣，牛羊下括。　又檢也。根刷也。【唐書·選舉志】明經者但記帖括。又【食貨志】鑄錢括苗。　又與筈通。【釋名】矢末曰括。謂與弦相會也。【書·太甲】若虞機張，往省括于度，則釋。　又與髻通。絜髮也。【禮·檀弓】袒括髮。　又【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?戸栝切，音活。會也。與佸同。【詩·小雅】德音來括。【箋】會合離散之人。　又【集韻】苦活切，音闊。亦與筈同。

括字的源字形

括字的起名意思

意为包容、约束。形容人胸襟广阔，宽容大度。

include
Basic explanation of words
include
kuò
Tie, bundle: include hair (to tie up the hair). Sphincter.
Inclusive: include. Generalize. In a nutshell. include.
include
guā
ㄍ ㄨ ㄚˉ
Squeeze, search: search (also known as "search").
include
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [kuò]
["Guangyun" is ancient and lively, enter the end, see. ]
["Jiyun" hard and lively, at the end, the stream. ]
Also known as "1".
(1) Ligation and binding.
(2) The extension refers to constraints.
(3) Block; occlusion.
(4) Tolerant; include.
(5) Summary of examinations used to refer to the imperial examination. Refer to Qing Zhaoyi's "Gaiyu Collection of Exams · Tie Kuo Chou Kuo".
(6) Collect; collect.
(7) Inspection and registration.
(8) Meeting; coming.
(9) Law.
(10) Dialects. Slap, hit.
(11) Through "Cotton". The end of the arrow meets the bowstring.
(12) It is said that the arrow is wound.
(13) Through "廥". warehouse.
[②]［guō］
["Guangyun" is ancient and lively, enter the end, see. ]
Same as "聒1".
[③] [guā]
(1) Cut; cut off.
(2) Friction.
(3) Blow.
(4) See "fresh".
include

draw together, include
include

[Easy·Kun Gua] It has no blame and no reputation. Also [coupa] move but not include. 【Sparse】Compounding is also a hindrance. [Former Han·Xiang Chuanzan] Bao Juyu, encompassing the whole world. 【Yangtze Dialect】Including closure.　[Guangyun] to also. 【Poetry·Wang Feng】At the eve of the sun, the cow and the sheep are surrounded.　Check again. Root brush also. 【Book of Tang·Election History】Ming Scriptures are only included in notes. Also 【Shihuozhi】cast money and seedlings.　It is connected with Yao again. [Release name] The end of the arrow is said to include. It means meeting with the string. [Book·Taijia] If Yujizhang, go to the province to include in the degree, then release.　 and 髻-linked again.絜发 also. 【Li·Tan Gong】The hair is covered with hair.　[Jiyun] [Rhyme] [Zhengyun]? 戸栝切, sound lively. Will also. Same as the same. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Enclosed in German accent. [J] Meeting the separated people.　[Jiyun] Hard and lively, wide sound. Also the same as Yao.

Source glyph
include
Name meaning
It means tolerance and restraint. Describes a broad-minded, tolerant and generous person.
会意字。从手(),篆书形体像手,表示用手来扎束;从昏,昏有塞口义,含束缚的意味。隶、楷书从(手),表示动手
扎束;从舌,舌被口腔所围,受到束缚。本义是扎、束。

总括古今 охватывать (обнимать, обобщать) и древность и современность

гл. Б
1) делать обыски; производить реквизиции (см. 搜括)
2) * приходить, прибывать
羊牛下括 спускаются вниз и овцы и коровы
3) * торопиться, спешить
动而不括 действовать, но без спешки
II сущ. guā
* вм. 栝 (конец древка стрелы)
Radicals: 扌, 舌  (fingers, tongue)
Meaning Mnemonic
Someone's fingers touch your tongue and fasten it together. You can't talk. All you can do is make sad tongue-less sounds as you try to figure out who would fasten your tongue like this.
Try to fasten your own tongue with your fingers right now. You probably can't do it, right? That's because your fingers are too big and your tongue is too slippery.
Reading Mnemonic
Only one creature could use its fingers to fasten your tongue like this: cats (かつ). Cats are notorious for fastening tongues so that people can't speak. Haven't you ever heard the phrase, "Cat got your tongue?"
In this case, many cats fastened your tongue. You should probably be nicer to cats from now on so this doesn't happen again.
